newsitem.title: UK: AIM Global names managing director.
newsitem.headline: AIM Global names managing director.

text.p: UK money market fund manager AIM Global said on Friday it had appointed Anthony Myers managing director.
Myers was previously managing director of Gartmore Money Management.
William Kleh, who has served as managing director of AIM Global since its inception in 1994, will continue as chairman.
"AIM approached me to work with them at a time when I had already become convinced that the climate was right for the expansion of money market funds in the UK market," Myers said.

"To date we have achieved a great deal of success in bringing this service to UK-based institutions and I am certain that these products will soon be accepted as a logical alternative to cash deposits," he said.
Over the past 18 months, AIM Global has expanded with the launch of dollar and sterling money market funds targeted at UK financial institutions. - James Saft, London newsroom +171 542 2734
